newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Hambrecht backs Datum on Q3.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Hambrecht backs Datum on Q3.

text.p: Datum is on track to meet or beat third quarter earnings projections, a Hambrecht & Quist analyst said in comments to his sales force Wednesday, seeking to dispel rumors the quarter could be shy of estimates.

Analyst Joe Noel said Datum, a supplier of miniature atomic clock equipment used to control the radio frequencies of personal communication services (PCS) wireless phones, is poised to benefit from ties to Lucent Technologies Inc.
Noel also said he expected Datum stock reaching his $50 target price within three months.
Datum stock was up more than five points at 37-3/8 in mid-morning trading.
"There's a few rumors that the quarter is light," Noel said, referring to the current third quarter. "We don't think those rumors are true."
The Hambrecht analyst has projected that Datum will earn $0.35 per share on $34 million in revenues during the third quarter. The current consensus for the quarter is $0.34, according to First Call.
Noel believed both Motorola Inc and Lucent are accepting as many Datum products as the company can produce.
"Our concern is not, 'Are there enough orders?' but, 'Can they manufacture enough to satisfy the demand?'" he said.

He expected the Lucent's contract with Ameritech Corp, estimated by Noel to be valued at between $700 million to more than $1 billion over five years, will result in revenues for Datum from Lucent by the 1997 fourth quarter.
He noted that Datum is the exclusive supplier of atomic clocks to Lucent, which has no second source for the product.
The analyst is projecting earnings of $1.31 per share for 1997 as a whole on revenues of $130 million and 1998 earnings of $1.61 per share on revenues of $150 million.
"We are expecting an upside to those numbers," Noel told Reuters. "Those numbers are on the conservative side."
"We will not change (our projections). We will let the company beat them, but we have a high level of confidence in those numbers."
